results.title: The Dismissal
results.creator_credit: John Power, Carl Schultz, George Ogilvie, Phil Noyce, George Miller, Terry Hayes and Kennedy-Miller
results.brief_description: A fictional account of the events that led up to the decision, made by Sir John Kerr, to sack Gough Whitlam as Prime Minister and appoint Malcolm Fraser in his place.

constellations_other.name: George Miller
constellations_other.description: For a guy who started his career as a physician, George Miller sure is a diverse filmmaker.

results.creator_credit_for_label: John Power, Carl Schultz, George Ogilvie, Phil Noyce, George Miller, Terry Hayes and Kennedy-Miller
results.description: A fictional account of the events that led up to the decision, made by Sir John Kerr, to sack Gough Whitlam as Prime Minister and appoint Malcolm Fraser in his place. The events covered occurred over the period between 1972 and 1975 and have been arranged, in the film, into six parts. Cast: Peter Carroll, Bill Hunter, John Hargreaves, John Meillon, Max Phipps, John Stanton, Arthur Dignam, Ruth Cracknell, Nancy Hayes.
description_for_label: A fictional account of the events that led up to the decision, made by Sir John Kerr, to sack Gough Whitlam as Prime Minister and appoint Malcolm Fraser in his place. results.title: The Discreet charm of the bourgeoisie
results.creator_credit: Luis Bunuel, Serge Silberman and Greenwich Film Production Paris
results.brief_description: The efforts of a group of friends to dine together are continually frustrated in this often hilarious surrealistic fable. As if in a dream, things go awry for all the characters in this, Luis Bunuel’s deliciously comical and brilliantly performed masterpiece. Co-written by Bunuel and Jean-Claude Carriere. English subtitles.

results.title: The Discovery of insulin
results.creator_credit: Stanley Jackson, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Here is the inspiring story of how, in July, 1921, in a little-used laboratory at the University of Toronto, two young Canadians, Frederick Banting and Charles Best, discovered insulin. Their work gave the hope of life and health to the world’s millions of diabetics. (An abridged version of The Quest)

results.title: Sky's Adventure [game trailer]
results.creator_credit: Willow McFadzean, Parker Arnel and Hurstbridge Primary School
results.brief_description: ‘Sky’s Adventure’ is about a girl Sky and a mean girl Britney. Britney was never nice to anyone but she has to reflect on that when Sky says something to her. Will Britney change after reflecting on what she’s done or keep doing it?

results.title: Time Machine [game trailer]
results.creator_credit: Werner van Niekerk, Cameron Cockrell and Tea Tree Gully Primary School
results.brief_description: ‘Time Machine’ is about robots that take over the world but there is a scientist that builds a robot that will take back the world. So it is your job to get past the boss. When you get past the boss you get a high score and the minions will try to kill you so watch out and have fun. There are bouncing pads that can help you jump higher and get things like health and score and save you too. There is also health which goes down when you are hit by evil robots or fireballs. Health packs increase your health.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Werner van Niekerk, Cameron Cockrell and Tea Tree Gully Primary School

results.title: 100 Pages
results.brief_description: ‘100 Pages’ is a project based upon the theme of North Sydney Girls High School’s Centenary. This project used the School’s identity and history as inspiration for artmaking. Through the artmaking, students are celebrating the school’s identity in the present and past community; isolating individual events, subjects and objects as inspiration. The title of the unit, ‘100 Pages’, comes from the initial idea of 100 animations, for 100 years of history. This project has been developed for the Stage 5 elective, Year 10 Photography and Digital Media class (PDM), which comprises 12 students from North Sydney Girls High School.

results.title: Project Vena Cava [game trailer]
results.brief_description: ‘Project Vena Cava’ is an ambitious atmospheric first-person shooter with dark cinematic elements. Its storyline is science fiction themed and is delivered primarily through written documents found throughout the game, as well as a voiceover that accompanies the player throughout. It is similar in style to other sci-fi first-person shooters such as ‘Halo’, ‘Metroid Prime’ and ‘Portal’.

results.title: 'Screen It' 2014 - Winners
results.brief_description:
‘Screen It’ was Australia’s national film, animation and game making competition for school-aged students, run by ACMI for 16 years to 2019.

Designed to encourage imagination and inventiveness in primary and secondary school students, ‘Screen It’ fostered a new generation of young media makers. In 2014 budding young film and game-makers took up the challenge of creating their own short film or game in response to the theme ‘Reflection.’

Witness first-hand the amazing winning entries of the 2014 Screen It competition!

results.title: La Mia Vita = My Life
results.brief_description: An elderly Italian man decides to look through his photo album. This causes him to reflect on his life. From his youth, to his adolescence, through to his older years, the man looks back on the moments of his life that he treasures the most, and those that are very dear to his heart.
